books.title: Darkwater
books.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
books.summary: A collection of essays, short fiction, and poetry related to the lives of black people in Jim Crow-era America.

books.title: Lorna Doone
books.author: R. D. Blackmore
books.summary: A young yeoman farmer falls in love with a beautiful girl who belongs to the outlaw clan which killed his father.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Kidnapped
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After his parents die, a young Scottish man travels to see his only remaining relative, expecting to be welcomed, but instead finds his life and liberty in grave danger.

books.title: A Woman of No Importance
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A mother’s secretive past clashes with high society when her son is offered an irresistible position with a charismatic nobleman.

books.title: Troilus and Cressida
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A Trojan prince falls in love with a woman amid the Trojan War, only to see her exchanged to the Greeks for a prisoner of war.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: R. A. Lafferty
books.summary: A collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by R. A. Lafferty ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Gitanjali
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Prose poems of offering translated by the author from the original Bengali.

books.title: Melmoth the Wanderer
books.author: Charles Robert Maturin
books.summary: A set of overlapping tales tell the story of a mysterious, malevolent, ageless stranger.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective returns to London after having faked his death some years before, and investigates a series of baffling mysteries.

books.title: The Social Contract
books.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
books.summary: Rousseau explores the political philosophy of authority originating from the consent of the people.

books.title: Nicomachean Ethics
books.author: Aristotle
books.summary: Aristotle examines how one may live in the most thriving, excellent manner.

books.title: How to Tell the Birds from the Flowers and Other Woodcuts
books.author: Robert Williams Wood
books.summary: A physicist writes and illustrates a collection of humorous poems responding to the Nature Fakers controversy.

books.title: Lady Windermere’s Fan
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A witty comedy that subverts the harsh social codes of Victorian England.

books.title: The Airlords of Han
books.author: Philip Francis Nowlan
books.summary: Science fiction hero Buck Rogers continues his crusade against the evil Han empire.

books.title: The Confessions of Arsène Lupin
books.author: Maurice Leblanc
books.summary: The gentleman-thief relates stories of his outwitting the Parisian detectives.

books.title: A Day at a Time
books.author: Archibald Alexander
books.summary: A 1916 Christian devotional reflecting on faith and morality during World War I.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.
